title: Can wisdom be made plural to wisdoms? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question was - Can wisdom be made plural to wisdoms? Can you write ‘wisdoms,’ certainly but it is not an accepted usage in English. (And I did some checking to be sure.) It is usually pluralized by context - ‘there are many types of wisdom.’ Thanks for the A2A.

‘wisdom’ is not a countable noun; hence you cannot say ‘wisdoms’. There cannot be ‘different wisdoms’. e.g. She is wise enough to answer this question. She has wisdom to answer this question. I hope this helps.

WISDOMS can work. Example = Several wisdoms passed through my mind as I contemplated the answer.  And = Many wisdoms were bestowed upon King Solomon. Usually, however, WISDOMS doesn’t work as a plural.

It is grammatically correct to use the word wisdoms, but it has a specific meaning, which is different from wisdom. “Wisdoms” means a collection of wise sayings or thoughts, such as in a book of essays. It is a limited and specific noun referring only to a collection.
